page.title: 04Avalon Lakes Scheme.
page.content: For the Ashcott Peat Works. In 1969, the Somerset River Authority recognised that there were possibilities for the worked_out peat areas. They could be used for land drainage , water storage and{recreation. Proposals were prepared for the future use of the peat moors. This is known as the Avalon Lakes Scheme. This would involve the{flooding}of the {peat}moors which only have enough reserves to last for approximately 27 years. There will be a series of{lakes} of different sizes. This plan and others for the after use of the moors are currently being examined in the course of preparing the subject local plan for peat.
